pull.title: policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_feeEstimator
pull.body:
* Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator`
* ~~Add missing `cs_feeEstimator` locks~~

issue.title: Meta-issue: Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations
issue.body:
This meta-issue tracks the status of the Clang thread safety analysis PRs.

- [x] Fix `-Wthread-safety-analysis` warnings. Compile with `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available. (#10866)
- [x] travis: Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X (#10923)
- [x] net: Add missing lock in `ProcessHeadersMessage(...)` (#11578)
- [x] addrman: Add missing lock in `Clear()` (CAddrMan) (#11585)
- [x] rpc: Lock `cs_main` in `blockToJSON`/`blockheaderToJSON` (#11618)
- [x] Avoid lock: Call `FlushStateToDisk(...)` regardless of `fCheckForPruning` (#11617)
- [x] tests: Add missing locks to tests (#11623)
- [x] Add missing `cs_wallet`/`cs_KeyStore` locks to wallet (#11634)
- [ ] Add missing locks: `validation.cpp` + related (#11652)
- [x] mempool: Fix missing locking in `CTxMemPool::check(…)` and `CTxMemPool::setSanityCheck(…)` (#11689)
- [x] qt: Remove redundant locks (#11733)
- [x] net: Add missing locks in `net.{cpp,h}` (#11744)
- [x] Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread (#11762)
- [x] net: Avoid locking `cs_vNodes` twice when calling `FindNode(...)`. Add `NodeExists(...)` (#11795)
- [x] tests: Make `test_bitcoin` pass under ThreadSanitzer (`clang`). Fix lock-order-inversion (potential deadlock). (#12882)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_KeyStore` runtime locking assertions (#13077)
- [x] mempool: Add compile time checking for all `::mempool.cs` runtime locking assertions (#13080)
- [x] wallet: Add compile time checking for all `cs_wallet` runtime locking assertions (#13081)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_main` runtime locking assertions (#13083)
- [x] wallet/keystore: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_KeyStore` (#13114)
- [x] addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_addrMan` (#13115)
- [x] Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_{rpcWarmup,nTimeOffset,warnings}` (#13116)
- [x] net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code (#13123)
- [x] scheduler: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `m_cs_callbacks_pending` (#13125)
- [x] util: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_args` (#13126)
- [x] wallet: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_db` (#13127)
- [x] policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator` (#13128)
- [x] Move `cs_main` locking annotations from `.cpp` to `.h` (#14063)
- [x] tests: Add missing locking annotations and locks (`g_cs_orphans`) (#14108)
- [x] Add compile time checking for `cs_main` locks which we assert at run time (#14444)

issue.title: wallet: Remove unused local variable old_label
issue.body:
Remove unused local variable `old_label`.

Last use was removed in #13825.

issue.title: Minor style enhancement in documentation
issue.body:
It is considered a best practice to avoid noun+verb contractions in technical documentation as it makes it easier to read, especially for non native English speakers.
As a reference: https://developers.google.com/style/contractions

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#10443](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/10443.html) (Add fee_est tool for debugging fee estimation code by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Add fee_est tool for debugging fee estimation code
issue.body:
This PR adds an `-estlog` option for saving live fee estimation data from a bitcoin node, and a `fee_est` command line tool for processing the data and testing fee estimation code.

The idea is to make it easier to test improvements to fee estimation like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10199 in a more systematic and reproducible way.

Some documentation is in [`src/test/fee_est/README.md`](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/blob/pr/fee/src/test/fee_est/README.md)

Sample log file: [`est.log.xz`](https://storage.googleapis.com/ryanofsky/est.log.xz) (65M)

Sample [`fee_est.cpp`](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/blob/pr/fee/src/test/fee_est/fee_est.cpp)  graph output: 

![graph](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7133040/26331057/f2de8d0c-3f1c-11e7-99ea-de1801d13b05.png)

events.body: @Empact @MarcoFalke Updated. Would you mind re-reviewing? The current version is annotations only, so no change in locking. In other words: this PR changes only compile-time checking and no runtime behaviour. Should hence hopefully be trivial to review :-)

issue.title: Add missing locks: validation.cpp + related

events.message: policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by cs_feeEstimator

scripted-diff: Rename from cs_feeEstimator to m_cs_fee_estimator

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's/cs_feeEstimator/m_cs_fee_estimator/' src/policy/fees.cpp src/policy/fees.h
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-
Add locking annotations to feeStats, shortStats and longStats

events.body: Any chance of getting this reviewed? It is a compile time check only :-)

Adding `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_feeEstimator)` to `processBlockTx` caused a bunch of problems in #10443 due to `cs_feeEstimator` being a private member. In [pr/fee.30](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/fee.30), `CTxMemPool::removeForBlock` would call `CBlockPolicyEstimator::processBlock`, which would lock `cs_feeEstimator`, and then call a lambda passed from the caller to loop through transactions, calling `CBlockPolicyEstimator::processTx` which would call `CBlockPolicyEstimator::processBlockTx`. The new annotation to added `processBlockTx` caused the compiler to error on these calls.

The errors were spurious, since `cs_feeEstimator` was locked the entire time, but because `cs_feeEstimator` was a private member of `CBlockPolicyEstimator`, there was no way to annotate the lambda asserting that `cs_feeEstimator` was locked. Making the mutex public would have solved the problem, but instead in [pr/fee.31](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/fee.31) I opted to fix the problem by hiding the `processBlockTx` call in another callback to be less invasive and simplify some other things.

Just wanted to note this because some people were curious about it. I thought it was interesting because:

- There can sometimes be a tension between wanting to make mutexes private, and wanting to make assertions about them in code outside the class.

- There doesn't seem to be any way to annotate a `std::function` variable asserting that a mutex must always be locked before the function is called, and requiring the compiler to check this. It's possible to annotate a lambda assigned to a `std::function` variable, asserting that various mutexes are locked, but these assertions are completely unchecked and uncheckable without a way to annotate std::functions.

comments.body: Might as well rename to `m_cs_fee_estimator` according to developer notes.
I don't think we need exclusive locking here, as `GetMaxConfirms` is a read so concurrent access wouldn't result in incoherent data.
`get` is a read of the ptr value, which is only updated in the constructor, so this lock is unnecessary AFAICT. `PT_GUARDED_BY` could be more appropriate.
nit: did you try marking these `PT_GUARDED_BY`? Seems it would be appropriate, based on the lock in `estimateRawFee`.
